{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3001173,"name":"יהלי","username":"ToolyGreenBlitz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/toolygreenblitz/{size}/199470_2.png","created_at":"2022-02-01T14:10:54.941Z","cooked":"

Hi guys!
Greenblitz 4590 from Israel here
In the past we’ve built a WCD chassis using (the equivilent of) 2" x 1" x 0.1" aluminum extrusion. (It’s actually 50mm x 25mm x 3mm). Which still works fine.

We’re using vex’ Clamping bearing block (Clamping Bearing Blocks (6 choices) - VEX Robotics)

For this year we’re thinking about using a 50mm x 20mm x 2mm aluminum extrusion, but we’re a bit uncertain if we should be concerned about the strength of the extrusion.
Wondering if anyone had any experience with using something close to a 2" x 0.75" x 0.075" alu extrusion for a WCD robot?

Thanks a lot!
Yahli

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2022-02-01T14:10:54.941Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":26,"reads":283,"readers_count":282,"score":186.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":401896,"topic_slug":"wcd-using-2-x-0-75-x-0-075-aluminium-extrusion","display_username":"יהלי","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.vexrobotics.com/bearingblocks.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Clamping Bearing Blocks (6 choices) - VEX Robotics","clicks":9}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49836,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/wcd-using-2-x-0-75-x-0-075-aluminium-extrusion/401896/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3001180,"name":"Zander","username":"Xenite","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/xenite/{size}/177081_2.png","created_at":"2022-02-01T14:23:21.891Z","cooked":"

No experience running 2 x 0.75 but the wall thickness definitely won’t be and issue, I know plenty of team including us have used 2 x 1 x 0.0625 without issue. The only thing to note is that the wall will be too thin to hold a bearing by itself but if your using clamping bearing blocks that’s not an issue.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2022-02-01T14:23:21.891Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":266,"readers_count":265,"score":53.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":401896,"topic_slug":"wcd-using-2-x-0-75-x-0-075-aluminium-extrusion","display_username":"Zander","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":45419,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Full Sends Only | they/he"},"post_url":"/t/wcd-using-2-x-0-75-x-0-075-aluminium-extrusion/401896/2","custom_user_title":"Full Sends Only | they/he","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3001188,"name":"","username":"Akash_Rastogi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png","created_at":"2022-02-01T14:48:14.861Z","cooked":"

I don’t see any inherent issue with this kind of setup, especially with bearing blocks. As long as you feel you have enough surface to mount stuff, I guess you’re good. But in terms of strength, I don’t see a reason to be concerned. Keep in mind a lot of COTS components are geared towards mounting to 1" or 2" faces, so you might have some challenges there if you’re going with majority COTS parts.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2022-02-01T14:52:12.543Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":236,"readers_count":235,"score":87.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":401896,"topic_slug":"wcd-using-2-x-0-75-x-0-075-aluminium-extrusion","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8002,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty"},"post_url":"/t/wcd-using-2-x-0-75-x-0-075-aluminium-extrusion/401896/3","custom_user_title":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3001193,"name":"","username":"BrendanB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/brendanb/{size}/236167_2.png","created_at":"2022-02-01T14:54:03.021Z","cooked":"

We ran our 8wd WCD in 2020/2021 using Clamping Versablocks and 2" x 1" x 0.0625" wall aluminum. No issues over two years of practice, at home challenges, and seven days on a real field. Would run again.

The only difference with your .75" extrusion would be the bearings will be closer together on the shaft by 1/4" overall. Shouldn’t be an issue. Using the Versablocks you are getting an actual spacing above an 1". Many teams have run WCDs in 2"x1"x.125" or .1" wall extrusion with bearings pressed into the tubing & no bearing blocks. Your’s have the benefit of being in a thick Versablock for additional support.

Unless its a cheap grade of aluminum & like @Akash_Rastogi points out some COTS parts might not like .75" overall thickness. You should be fine.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2022-02-01T14:54:33.485Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":221,"readers_count":220,"score":79.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":401896,"topic_slug":"wcd-using-2-x-0-75-x-0-075-aluminium-extrusion","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10103,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3467 Lead Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/wcd-using-2-x-0-75-x-0-075-aluminium-extrusion/401896/4","custom_user_title":"3467 Lead Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3001212,"name":"CEF","username":"CEF","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/35a633/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-02-01T16:16:39.588Z","cooked":"

I would be much more concerned with the specific aluminum alloy. Stick with 6061 – the only time we had anything bend was when I picked up 2x1 extrusion at the local metal store but didn’t specify the alloy and came back with 6063.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2022-02-01T16:16:39.588Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":159,"readers_count":158,"score":51.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":401896,"topic_slug":"wcd-using-2-x-0-75-x-0-075-aluminium-extrusion","display_username":"CEF","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28649,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/wcd-using-2-x-0-75-x-0-075-aluminium-extrusion/401896/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3001222,"name":"Ari Meles-Braverman","username":"AriMB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arimb/{size}/189989_2.png","created_at":"2022-02-01T16:31:47.915Z","cooked":"

We ran WCD with 2mm wall the past few years. I think we used 50x25 but basically the same strength. I wouldn’t be worried about the strength as long as you have bearing blocks to support the wheel axles.

Thanks a lot for the help!
